docblock.long-description: Licensed under The MIT License For full copyright and license information, please see the LICENSE.txt Redistributions of files must retain the above copyright notice.
If you pass no more than two parameters, it tries to generate a html tag with the name of the method and works as alias of `tag()`.

docblock.description: Creates a badge, according to Bootstrap

docblock.long-description: If `$url` is not null, creates a link (`<a>` tag) with the appearance of a button.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Cake-relative URL or array of URL parameters or external URL

docblock.description: Adds a css file to the layout.
docblock.long-description: If it's used in the layout, you should set the `inline` option to `true`.

tag.name: param
tag.description: CSS filename or an array of CSS filenames

tag.name: param
tag.description: The options to use. Options not listed above will be treated as HTML attributes

tag.name: return
tag.description: String or `null`, depending on the value of $options['block']`

docblock.description: Begin a CSS block that captures output until `cssEnd()` is called. This capturing block will capture all output between the methods and create a cssBlock from it
End a buffered section of css capturing.
docblock.long-description: Generates a style tag inline or appends to specified view block depending on the settings used when the cssBlock was started.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Depending on the settings of `cssStart()`, either a style tag or null

docblock.description: Creates an heading, according to Bootstrap.
docblock.long-description:
This method is useful if you want to create an heading with a secondary text. In this case you have to use the `small` option.
By default, this method creates an `<h2>` tag. To create a different tag, you have to use the `type` option.
You can use the `$ratio` option (valid values: `16by9` or `4by3`) to create a responsive embed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Path to the image file, relative to the APP/webroot/img/ directory

docblock.description: Create a label, according to the Bootstrap component.
docblock.long-description:
This method creates only a label element. Not to be confused with the `label()` method provided by `Formhelper`, which creates a label for a form input.
You can set the type of label using the `type` option. The values supported by Bootstrap are: `default`, `primary`, `success`, `info`, `warning` and `danger`.
If `$element` is an array, the same `$options` will be applied to all elements

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content to be wrapped by tags

tag.name: param
tag.description: Cake-relative URL or array of URL parameters or external URL

docblock.description: Creates a link to an external resource and handles basic meta tags

tag.name: param
tag.description: The address of the external resource or string for content attribute

tag.name: param
tag.description: Other attributes for the generated tag. If the type attribute is html, rss, atom, or icon, the mime-type is returned

docblock.description: Adds a js file to the layout.
docblock.long-description: If it's used in the layout, you should set the `inline` option to `true`.

tag.name: return
tag.description: String of `<script />` tags or `null` if `$inline` is false or if `$once` is true and the file has been included before

docblock.description: Starts capturing output for Javascript code.
docblock.long-description:
To end capturing output, you can use the `scriptEnd()` method.
To capture output with a single method, you can also use the `scriptBlock()` method.
Note that this code only renders the Shareaholic "share button". To add the "setup code", you have to use the `LayoutHelper`.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Tag content. If null, only a start tag will be printed

docblock.description: Adds the `viewport` meta tag. By default, it uses options as required by Bootstrap

tag.name: param
tag.description: Attributes for the generated tag. If the type attribute is html, rss, atom, or icon, the mime-type is returned

docblock.long-description: You can use the `$ratio` option (valid values: `16by9` or `4by3`) to create a responsive embed.

docblock.description: Creates breadcrumbs, according to the Bootstrap component
Add a crumb to the end of the trail

tag.name: param
tag.description:
If provided as a string, it represents the title of the crumb. Alternatively you can provide an array, with each values being a single crumb. Arrays are expected to be of this form:

  • title The title of the crumb
  • link The link of the crumb
  • options Options of the crumb

tag.name: param
tag.description: URL of the crumb. Either a string, an array of route params to pass to Url::build() or null/empty

tag.name: param
tag.description:
Array of options. These options will be used as attributes HTML attribute the crumb will be rendered in (a

  • tag by default). It accepts two special keys:

    • innerAttrs: An array that allows you to define attributes for the inner element of the crumb (by default, to the link)
    • templateVars: Specific template vars in case you override the templates provided

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

docblock.description: Prepend a crumb to the start of the queue

tag.name: param
tag.description:
If provided as a string, it represents the title of the crumb. Alternatively you can provide an array, with each values being a single crumb. Arrays are expected to be of this form:

  • title The title of the crumb
  • link The link of the crumb
  • options Options of the crumb

tag.name: param
tag.description: URL of the crumb. Either a string, an array of route params to pass to Url::build() or null/empty

tag.name: param
tag.description:
Array of options. These options will be used as attributes HTML attribute the crumb will be rendered in (a

  • tag by default). It accepts two special keys:

    • innerAttrs: An array that allows you to define attributes for the inner element of the crumb (by default, to the link)
    • templateVars: Specific template vars in case you override the templates provided

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of attributes applied to the wrapper template

tag.name: param

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

docblock.long-description:
If the existing value and the value to append are both strings, the strings will be concatenated. In any other cases, an array of elements will be created.
You can also pass an array with the keys and values as the only argument.

docblock.description: Used to read and delete a value from a key
Checks if a key contains a value.
docblock.long-description:
If the existing value is an array: - if you pass an array, the elements of the two arrays will be compared; - otherwise, it will be checked if the value you have passed is contained in the array.
In all other cases, the value you have passed and your existing value will be compared.

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

docblock.description: Internal function to generate datepicker and timepicker.
docblock.long-description: Bootstrap Datepicker and Moment.js should be installed via Composer.

docblock.description: Before layout callback. beforeLayout is called before the layout is rendered
Create a script block for Google Analytics

docblock.long-description:
To know how to install and configure CKEditor, please refer to the `README.md` file.
CKEditor must be located into `APP/webroot/ckeditor`.
To create an input field for CKEditor, you should use the `ckeditor()` method provided by the `FormHelper`.

tag.name: param
tag.description: true if you want to use the jQuery adapter

docblock.description: Adds a datepicker to the `$input` field.
docblock.long-description:
To create an input field compatible with datepicker, you should use the `datepicker()` method provided by the `FormHelper`.
Bootstrap Datepicker and Moment.js should be installed via Composer.

docblock.description: Adds a datetimepicker to the `$input` field.
docblock.long-description: To create an input field compatible with datetimepicker, you should use the `datetimepicker()` method provided by the `FormHelper`. Bootstrap Datepicker and Moment.js should be installed via Composer.
FancyBox must be installed via Composer.

docblock.description: Create a script block for Shareaholic.
docblock.long-description: Note that this code only adds the Shareaholic "setup code". To render the "share buttons", you have to use the `HtmlHelper`.

docblock.description: Through `slugify.js`, it provides the slug of a field.
docblock.long-description: It reads the value of the `$sourceField` field and it sets its slug in the `$targetField`.

docblock.description: Adds a timepicker to the `$input` field.
docblock.long-description:
To create an input field compatible with datepicker, you should use the `timepicker()` method provided by the `FormHelper`.
Bootstrap Datepicker and Moment.js should be installed via Composer.

docblock.description: This file is part of me-tools.
docblock.long-description: Licensed under The MIT License For full copyright and license information, please see the LICENSE.txt Redistributions of files must retain the above copyright notice.

docblock.long-description: This method creates a button. To create a POST button, you should use the `postButton()` method. Instead, to create a link with the appearance of a button, you should use the `button()` method provided by `HtmlHelper`.
To add the scripts for CKEditor, you should use the `LibraryHelper`.

docblock.description: Generates an input element complete with label and wrapper div

tag.name: param
tag.description: The model name for which the form is being defined. If false no model is used

docblock.long-description:
You can also create an inline form using the `create()` method with the `inline` option.
Note that by default `createInline` doesn't display help blocks and errors.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The model name for which the form is being defined. If false no model is used

docblock.long-description: To add the scripts for datepicker, you should use the `LibraryHelper`.
To add the scripts for datetimepicker, you should use the `LibraryHelper`.

docblock.description: Creates a button with a surrounding form that submits via POST.
docblock.long-description:
This method creates a button in a form element. So don't use this method in an already opened form.
To create a normal button, you should use the `button()` method. To create a button with the appearance of a link, you should use the `button()` method provided by the `HtmlHelper`.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Cake-relative URL or array of URL parameters or external URL

docblock.description: Creates a link with a surrounding form that submits via POST.
docblock.long-description:
This method creates a link in a form element. So don't use this method in an already opened form.
To create a normal link, you should use the `link()` method of the `HtmlHelper`.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content to be wrapped by tags

tag.name: param
tag.description: Cake-relative URL or array of URL parameters or external URL
